title: Wisdom in Relationships
shortSummary: Proverbs 27 offers practical wisdom on humility, friendship, foresight, and diligence. It emphasizes the value of honest counsel, prudent living, and faithful stewardship in daily life, highlighting the importance of godly relationships and wise conduct.

keyCharacters.name: The Wise Son
keyCharacters.description: The recipient of Solomon's instruction, representing those who seek and apply godly wisdom.

keyCharacters.name: Friend
keyCharacters.description: A key figure in the chapter, illustrating the importance of faithful counsel and honest rebuke.

keyCharacters.name: Fool
keyCharacters.description: A person characterized by wrath and folly, serving as a negative example throughout the chapter.

definitions.definition: To speak with pride or self-praise, often prematurely or arrogantly.
A person who takes responsibility for another's debt or obligation; a guarantor.
A vessel used to purify silver by removing impurities through heat.
Inclined to argue or quarrel; quarrelsome.

outline.heading: Warnings Against Pride and Anger
outline.description: This section cautions against boasting about the future and highlights the destructive power of wrath and envy, urging humility and self-control.

outline.heading: The Value of Honest Friendship
outline.description: Emphasizes the superiority of open rebuke and faithful wounds from friends over deceitful flattery, and stresses the importance of close, reliable relationships.

outline.heading: Prudence and Foresight
outline.description: Calls for wisdom and prudence in life, warning against simple folly and inappropriate behavior that can bring curses instead of blessings.

outline.heading: The Challenges of Relationships and Character
outline.description: Uses vivid imagery to describe the difficulties of living with contentious people and the unchanging nature of folly, while highlighting the sharpening effect of true friendship.

outline.heading: Diligence and Stewardship
outline.description: Encourages careful management of resources and foresight in provision, reminding that wealth is temporary and faithful stewardship leads to lasting provision.

application: Practice humility by trusting God with the future rather than boasting about tomorrow.
Cherish and seek honest, godly friends who will lovingly correct and encourage you.
Exercise prudence by anticipating difficulties and taking wise precautions in daily life.
Be diligent in managing your responsibilities, recognizing that faithful stewardship honors God.

keyVerses.text: Boast not thyself of to morrow; for thou knowest not what a day may bring forth.
keyVerses.significance: This verse teaches humility and reliance on God’s sovereign control over the future.

keyVerses.text: Faithful are the wounds of a friend; but the kisses of an enemy are deceitful.
keyVerses.significance: Highlights the value of truthful correction from friends over flattering deceit.

keyVerses.text: Iron sharpeneth iron; so a man sharpeneth the countenance of his friend.
keyVerses.significance: Illustrates how godly friendships refine and strengthen character.

keyVerses.text: Be thou diligent to know the state of thy flocks, and look well to thy herds.
keyVerses.significance: Encourages faithful stewardship and attentiveness to one’s responsibilities.
